newsitem.title: GERMANY: German DAX held back by autos in pre-bourse.
newsitem.headline: German DAX held back by autos in pre-bourse.

text.p: German shares were largely unchanged in Thursday pre-bourse trade after Wall Street's renewed gains as trading volumes remain low and dealers noted a pull downwards from losses among auto sector shares.
The IBIS-DAX index of electronic trade gained just 12.33 points to 3,359.87 in pre-bourse, with June DAX futures gaining 12.5 points to 3,369.5.

Daimler Benz fell 2.00 marks, around 1.5 percent, to 133.0 amid the highest volumes of the session as dealers said there was a degree of disappointment at the analysts' meeting following details of its 1996 results on Wednesday.
Shares in BMW, which have rallied in recent weeks, were also lower in early trade, dipping to a low of 1,365 marks from 1,425 marks before coming right back up to trade flat.
BMW chief Bernd Pischetsrieder said on Wedesday that BMW was only expecting "slight" earnings growth in 1997, a comment he clarified as meaning single digit percent growth.
Airline Lufthansa was little moved by a statement from the company saying its 1997 results would be above those in 1996. Its shares edged six pfennigs higher to 22.65.
